DataElement.preferredName: Measurement Whole Body Radiation Dosimetry Collection Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator of whether whole body dosimetry measurements were collected.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.:The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces._The measurement of radiation by photography, as in x-ray film and film badge, by Geiger-Mueller tube, and by scintillation counting._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

Property.preferredDefinition: The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces._The measurement of radiation by photography, as in x-ray film and film badge, by Geiger-Mueller tube, and by scintillation counting._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Concepts.definition: The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.
The measurement of radiation by photography, as in x-ray film and film badge, by Geiger-Mueller tube, and by scintillation counting.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
